titles.title: Kidou Senshi Gundam: Tekketsu no Orphans (2016)
Kidou Senshi Gundam: Tekketsu no Orphans S2
機動戦士ガンダム 鉄血のオルフェンズ (2016)
Mobile Suit Gundam: Iron Blooded Orphans - 2nd Season
机动战士高达 铁血的奥尔芬斯 第二季

relatedanime.anime: Kidou Senshi Gundam: Tekketsu no Orphans

recommendations.recommendation:
Amazing series and a must watch! This series stays true to the Gundam series. The fight scenes are great and the story progresses well with great character development. There were unexpected turns throughout the story, but it keeps it going. the mech design were cool and every characters` stories just builds onto the Tekkadan`s goal.
The ending was a little disappointing since it didn`t go the way I wanted, but it feels realistic none the less.

If you like a good cast of characters brought in a whirl of the unfairness of life. Just fighting the fight to survive... And badass mecha. This is a must see. Brilliant script, gets better with each episodes.

One of the best gundam series for me. The series highlights most of the real life issues and how it`s not always rainbows and butterflies in the real world. Been on the ride with the crew made me felt very connected to Tekkadan (the protagonist). Each tragedy and turn of events gave me full burst of emotions. The ending is pretty well done, I wouldn`t want it any other way.
Recommended for everyone to watch. Thumbs up

anime.description: The Earth Sphere had lost its previous governing structure, and a new world was created under new systems of government. While a temporary peace had arrived, the seeds of a new conflict were being sown in the Mars Sphere, far away from Earth. Source: crunchyroll

externalentity.identifier: 機動戦士ガンダム_鉄血のオルフェンズ

tag.name: military
tag.description: The military, also known as the armed forces, are forces authorized and legally entitled to use deadly force so as to support the interests of the state and its citizens. The task of the military is usually defined as defence of the state and its citizens and the prosecution of war against foreign powers. The military may also have additional functions within a society, including construction, emergency services, social ceremonies, and guarding critical areas. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: child soldier
tag.description: Untrained and as yet immature, children are expediently thrust into the role of warriors to protect god, king, and country. Not having even finished school, they are inexplicably designated to elite status or roles, typically requiring months of training and years of experience. All the more so with "experimental" equipment or weapons of mass destruction.

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: collateral damage
tag.description: The usually action orientated anime does not only show large amounts of combat and weapon use, but also the incidental massive destruction of property, often due to the inability of the protagonists to aim properly. Example: Mecha duking it out in a densely populated urban area.

tag.name: gunfights
tag.description: Fights where two or more parties are firing guns at one another.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: human enhancement
tag.description: Human enhancement can take various forms: It can be something comparatively non-intrusive as a power-up drug, a form of machine implantation or cyberization (http://anidb.net/a4414 [SAC Solid State Society]), or outright - possibly atrocious - genetic manipulation (http://anidb.net/a361 [Ao no 6 Gou]). Plot-wise enhanced protagonists in anime usually have to pay a price for their enhancements, be it physical or mental.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: space travel
tag.description: Space Travel usually refers going to space or travelling there with or without a spacecraft. There are different forms of space travel like Interplanetary travel, Interstellar travel or Intergalactic travel. Since it isn`t possible to travel faster than light, most anime series involve some sort "sub-space travel mechanism" as a way to travel faster than light.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: other planet
tag.description: The anime will fit this category if some or all of the action takes place on another planet which is supposedly in the same universe as Earth, not a complete fantasy world; usually there has to be some concept of space travel. The Latin name for Earth - Terra, would also pass the condition of being in the same universe as Earth. Basically, even mentioning of Earth existing or having existed would be enough. Although Moon is a moon, it also qualifies as Other Planet.

tag.name: shipboard
tag.description: Beam me up, Scotty! Space stations (think Death Star) also count. Basically, this category is to tell if the setting takes place onboard a spaceship in space. This category is not applicable if the spaceship lies on a planet and never actually gets into space.

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: Mars
tag.description: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and the second-smallest planet in the Solar System after Mercury. In English, Mars carries a name of the Roman god of war, and is often referred to as the "Red Planet" because the reddish iron oxide prevalent on its surface gives it a reddish appearance that is distinctive among the astronomical bodies visible to the naked eye. Mars is a terrestrial planet with a thin atmosphere, having surface features reminiscent both of the impact craters of the Moon and the valleys, deserts, and polar ice caps of Earth. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: mafia
tag.description: A mafia is a type of organized crime syndicate whose primary activities are protection racketeering, the arbitration of disputes between criminals, and the organizing and oversight of illegal agreements and transactions. Secondary activities may be practiced such as gambling, drug trafficking, loan sharking, and fraud. The term was originally applied to the Sicilian mafia, but has since expanded to encompass other organizations of similar methods and purpose, such as in "the Russian mafia" or "the Japanese mafia", and is applied informally by the press and public, but the criminal organizations themselves have their own terms; for example, the original Sicilian and Italian-American mafia call themselves "cosa nostra", while the Japanese mafia calls itself "yakuza". Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: politics
tag.description: From commies to fat capitalist pigs, all the stuff done by the "guys with the power", mainly evil tactics for gaining more power over the masses. Watching this title may remind you why CNN is boring.

tag.name: crime
tag.description: The underworld we talk about here is not to be confused with the place where people are believed to go after they die, but the general term for organized crime. It is a shady world, unknown to most people, where illegal things like murder, smuggling, drug dealing and similar are happening daily. Groups known to be acting in this world are for example the mafia or the yakuza.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: revenge
tag.description: A primary factor that drives the plot forward, is the almost obsessive desire of one of the characters to get back at someone else.

tag.name: war
tag.description: War is a phenomenon of organized violent conflict, typified by extreme aggression, societal disruption and adaptation, and high mortality. The objective of warfare differs in accord with a group`s role in a conflict: The goals of offensive warfare are typically the submission, assimilation or destruction of another group, while the goals of defensive warfare are simply the repulsion of the offensive force and, often, survival itself. Relative to each other, combatants in warfare are called enemies. The terms military, militant, and militarism each refer to fundamental aspects of war, i.e. the organized group, the combative individual, and the supportive ethos (respectively). Source: wiki

tag.name: rotten world
tag.description: A rotten world is a setting or situation where the jaded notion that "anything that can go wrong will go horribly wrong" almost always applies. Oppression, perpetual warfare, lawlessness, despair or other forms of mental instability, and other highly undesirable factors tend to be rampant.

tag.name: space pirates
tag.description: Depending how you view the future, lawlessness will always be present in society. There`s always going to be a shadier, nastier way of doing business, and that will almost certainly follow humanity to the stars. Thus, sci-fi authors will include Expies of modern and historic (un)organized crime—be they space mafia, gangs, or—in our case—pirates. It`s not as anachronistic as it might seem. After all, pirates themselves have made a Real Life comeback in Somalia, and it`s a lucrative enough "business" that it`s taken a multinational military response to fight back. Surely an established society in outer space with significant trade and commerce would suffer similar problems! ... Well, maybe. The major problem with space pirates preying on space commerce is that space is vast. The challenge of catching commercial shipping in open space is orders of magnitudes more difficult than catching them on the open seas. Sometimes, this is cleverly worked around and justified. Most of the time, however, it isn`t. There are two kinds of Space Pirates in science fiction. The normal version are violent criminals with a spaceship, who attack other spaceships, just like present-day pirates. Once you have shipping between different solar systems/planets, pirates preying on said shipping are bound to show. Simple as that. Done this way, piracy actually makes sense, provided there`s an enabling factor. That could be anything from the technology of the setting creating trade lanes (via a Portal Network, predictable Faster Than Light Travel routes thanks to Negative Space Wedgies, or timed space flights between planets to reduce time spent between planets, as in Real Life), to using a variant of the method employed by modern pirates (say, smaller ships striking at commercial shipping in the orbit of a planet). The other version does a Recycled In SPACE on every eighteenth century pirate cliche ever. Reasons for including this version will typically be along the lines of "Because Space Is An Ocean, it has to have Pirates" rather than making any meaningful attempt at justifying their existence. They have Cornish accents, beards, say "Arr!" a lot, have parrots (probably robot) and false limbs (probably cybernetic) and wear tricorn hats and eyepatches (or have cybernetic eyes). They may even have ships shaped like boats. One of the best known space pirates is http://anidb.net/ch2087 [Captain Harlock] from the same named popular http://anidb.net/a725 [TV anime series]. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: promise
tag.description: A dramatically-made promise that serves as foreshadowing. The promise will eventually be called in and action will be required. Whether they succeed, fail or refuse to keep their promise depends almost entirely on the idealism-level of the story. Other factors, such as whether they were told what they had to do, or if it was a Leonine Contract, may come into play. Even Releasing from the Promise is usually a scene of high drama. Source: TVTropes

tag.name: teamwork
tag.description: A cooperative effort by the members of a group or team to achieve a common goal.

tag.name: kids in war
tag.description: When minors participate in armed conflict.

tag.name: talking is a free action
tag.description: Time in comics is flexible. Each panel shows a single event, which is usually accompanied by a length of dialog, which must take some time to say. This disparity is usually accepted if it isn`t taken to extremes. But often, characters will exposit when it`s most needed: at the story`s climax, when both the intricacies of the plot and the intensity of action hit their highest. While the Heroes Outrun the Fireball, Mr. Exposition might explain why the Evil Overlord`s death caused the explosion. The Action Girl can deliver impressive lectures on why the monster`s Achilles` Heel will work, while still engaging in Waif-Fu. The Superhero can quip to his heart`s content and explain his abilities while dueling one insignificant mobster, or deliver a Kirk Summation during the course of a single Finishing Move. Sometimes even apparent mere mortals can give a lecture on what is happening when it would be a much better idea to simply run like hell. Without stopping to breathe, apparently. Source: TvTrope

tag.name: space battles
tag.description: There are space battles in this anime. Usually between Earth forces and some alien invader, but ship to ship skirmishes in deep space are just as common.

tag.name: childhood promise
tag.description: Sweet childhood promises... who remembers them other than the Japanese anime characters? It keeps the main characters obsessed with promises that they made when they were children, mostly related to love, with lines like "I will always protect you" or "I will marry you when we grow up".

tag.name: murder
tag.description: To murder means to bring about someone else`s death, by a voluntary act. Whether it comes from the killer`s own hand or by exposing the victim to life-threatening circumstances, the result is foreseeable and sought by the perpetrator. Someone who murders as their profession/job is an http://anidb.net/t2399 [assassin or hitman].

tag.name: betrayal
tag.description: Friends become enemies. Strong bonds of trust receive violations of confidence while friendships are faithlessly given up or revealed to have been false from the start.

tag.name: lost technology
tag.description: Any advanced technology or science-related knowledge that was lost for some reason fits the description. This could be technology from a time before a post-apocalyptic cataclysm, knowledge gained a long time ago but forgotten, or the relics of an old alien civilization only recently discovered.

tag.name: time skip
tag.description: The plot features at least one skip or jump in time. Example: A skip from the present into the past, or time skips in increments, e.g. every hour there is a time skip by a day.

tag.name: war-zone realities
tag.description: War is hell. This tag is for when characters experience the hell of war... not just the exciting stuff blowing up part.

tag.name: poverty
tag.description: It refers to the condition of not having the means to afford basic human needs.

tag.name: following one`s dream
tag.description: No matter what the hardships may be, at least one of the protagonists in this anime is following her/his dream. Examples: To become a professional athlete, a musician, a painter or the ruler of this world!

tag.name: massacre
tag.description: Mass murder.

tag.name: heroic sacrifice
tag.description: "In order to save the many, the few will need to sacrifice their lives..." or so this character may think. In a seemingly hopeless situation, against impossible odds, the character does not choose the path of the coward and run, he or she chooses to bravely face the enemy, fully aware that this will mean death.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Mikazuki Augus
character.description: A member of the Martian private security firm CGS. Calm and collected, with a head for the big picture, he`s undyingly loyal to his friends. The most experienced mobile weapon operator in CGS, he is assigned to pilot the Gundam Barbatos. 2nd season:A boy who belongs to Tekkadan. During a previous battle with Gjallarhorn, he overused the Alaya-Vijnana system, and consequently he has lost all sensation in his right eye and hand. However, these sensations can be restored by connecting to the Alaya-Vijnana system, and so he has continued fighting as the pilot of the Gundam Barbatos Lupus. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Orga Itsuka
character.description: A leader among the boys of CGS. Naturally gifted as a commander, and trusted implicitly by the others, he strives to live up to their admiration. He`s especially close to Mikazuki, who he`s known since a very young age; their bond is closer than most blood brothers. His coup within CGS is launched to give the boys a place where they won`t be betrayed anymore. 2nd season:The leader of Tekkadan. He succeeded in earning overnight fame for Tekkadan during the fighting that surrounded the Arbrau representative election. Thanks to Tekkadan`s accomplishments, the organization has greatly expanded. But its family of members have not stopped working to protect the future, and they are determined to keep moving forward. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Biscuit Griffon
character.description: A boy who supports Orga in the role of a staff officer. He has a gentle personality and enjoys reading. Biscuit volunteered to enlist with CGS to pay the living expenses for his grandmother and his much younger twin sisters. Since he has actually attended school, his reading and writing skills are unusually good compared to the other boys. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Eugene Sevenstark
character.description: A boy member of CGS, and the leader of the boys until Orga joined. While physically and intellectually gifted, his impulsiveness renders him somewhat unlikable. Unhappy at having his position usurped by Orga, he begins to nurture a grudge. 2nd season:The deputy leader of Tekkadan. During battle, he sometimes takes command in Orga`s place. Lately he has been reading strategy guidebooks to take the load off his leader. His ability to pilot ships using the Alaya-Vijnana system is quite remarkable. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Norba Shino
character.description: A high-spirited boy member of CGS. His robust build makes him a natural at hand-to-hand combat. 2nd season:Captain of Tekkadan`s First Working Unit. He gives the impression of being a joker, but cares very much about his comrades. He also serves as a drill instructor for new recruits. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Akihiro Altland
character.description: The leader of a separate group of boys sold to CGS as "human debris", he`s cold, withdrawn, and cliquish. Often takes on risky front-line missions. His piloting skills are second only to Mikazuki`s. 2nd season:Captain of Tekkadan`s Second Working Unit. He has a well-trained body, and specializes in tasks such as defensive combat and long-duration mobile suit operation. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: EB-06 Graze
character.description: A state-of-the-art mobile suit constructed by Gjallarhorn, a military organization which monitors the world. It has a large selection of armament, and its weapons and equipment can be exchanged to suit the combat situation. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Dante Mogro
character.description: One of the "human debris" boys like Akihiro. 2nd season:A member of Tekkadan`s First Working Unit, who specializes in electronic warfare. With more mobile suits now in Tekkadan`s possession, his wish to become a mobile suit pilot is granted. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Chad Chadan
character.description: One of the "human debris" boys like Akihiro. 2nd season:A manager in Tekkadan`s Earth branch who has become a military advisor to Arbrau. With his good character and sense of responsibility, he is highly trusted by the group`s members. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Atra Mixta
character.description: A girl who works at a grocery in the city of Chryse. By delivering food to CGS, she has become friends with the CGS boys. In particular, she has slight crush on Mikazuki. 2nd season:Tekkadan`s head cook. Now that Tekkadan has a good cash flow, she can purchase new ingredients that she was previously never able to buy, and she invents new menu items on a daily basis. She remains as fond of Mikazuki as ever. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Kudelia Aina Bernstein
character.description: A girl involved in the Martian independence movement. She is headed for Earth in order to negotiate privately with the government of Arbrau, and CGS has been commissioned to escort her there. It was Kudelia who successfully convened the "Noachis July Assembly," a gathering of independence movements, which attracted attention from all quarters. 2nd season:After the Arbrau prime minister election, she completed the negotiations over halfmetal rights and returned to Mars. Establishing the Admoss Company to handle the primary processing and distribution of halfmetal, she now serves as its representative. She is still active in advocating for Mars`s economic independence, sponsoring work for the unemployed, and so forth. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Takaki Uno
character.description: One of the leaders of the CGS boys. Within the group he is responsible for a variety of tasks, such as delivering messages and supplies. He admires Mikazuki for piloting the Gundam Barbatos. 2nd season:A member of Tekkadan`s Earth branch, who is renting an apartment with his sister Fuka. With his kind-hearted and caring personality, he helps Chad run the Earth branch. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: McGillis Fareed
character.description: A young but capable Gjallarhorn special forces major who visits the Martian headquarters for an inspection. He is also an excellent pilot, and has his own Schwalbe Graze. 2nd season:After the death of Carta Issue, he has become the commander of the Outer Earth Orbit Regulatory Joint Fleet. He is trying to erase the suspicions of Earth`s economic blocs toward Gjallarhorn. As he participates in meetings of the Seven Stars as a representative of the Fareed family, his influence within Gjallarhorn continues to expand. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Yamagi Gilmerton
character.description: A taciturn boy who belongs to CGS. He specializes in maintaining machines. 2nd season:A Tekkadan mechanic. Together with Yukinojo, he is responsible for maintaining Tekkadan`s mobile suits and mobile workers. Though taciturn, he has a kindly nature. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Ride Mass
character.description: One of the CGS boys. He is sharp-tongued but cares for his comrades. 2nd season:He designed the Tekkadan emblem. As a member of Akihiro`s Second Working Unit, he fights on the front lines during combat. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Nadi Yukinojou Kassapa
character.description: A CGS mechanic who originally specializes in mobile worker maintenance. He strongly sympathizes with Orga and the others. 2nd season:The mechanic who manages Tekkadan`s maintenance crew. Though he previously had a hard time maintaining unfamiliar mobile suits, his mechanical knowledge has increased thanks to technical support from Teiwaz, and he now issues precise instructions in the hangar. Quietly watching over Tekkadan as an adult, he is their reliable "Old Man." Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Todo Mirconen
character.description: A member of CGS`s first corps, who is in charge of the child soldiers. He makes his way in the world by going with the flow. 2nd season:A former CGS soldier. He now serves under McGillis as executive director of the Montag company, and is responsible for negotiations with Tekkadan. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Dexter Culastor
character.description: The chief accountant of CGS. He is one of the few at CGS who has no prejudices against the boys. 2nd season:Previously a member of the private security company CGS, the predecessor to Tekkadan, he was retained by Tekkadan due to his expertise in accounting. He currently serving as treasurer of Tekkadan`s Martian headquarters. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Sakura Pretzel
character.description: Biscuit`s grandmother, who runs a farm on Mars. Mikazuki fondly addresses her as "Miss Sakura." Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Naze Turbine
character.description: The leader of Turbines, the subsidiary which runs Teiwaz`s transport division. He is known in the Jupiter Sphere for his aggressive attitude, and is highly trusted by Teiwaz representative McMurdo Barriston. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Amida Arca
character.description: Naze`s caring and helpful primary wife. She pilots a Hyakuren painted in her personal colors. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Lafter Frankland
character.description: Naze`s girlfriend, who has a cheerful personality. She mainly pilots the highly mobile Hyakuri. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Azee Gurumin
character.description: A Turbines member who pilots a Hyakuren. She executes her missions calmly. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Kyoushuu Soukoukan Isaribi
character.description: A space warship that originally belonged to Maruba, who called it "Will-O`-The-Wisp." Orga seizes it when he founds Tekkadan, and changes it name to "Isaribi." One of the non-Gjallarhorn warships equipped with an Ahab reactor, it is an armored assault ship that was used during the Calamity War era, and subsequently upgraded. It has many gun turrets, but these cannot deliver a decisive blow against nanolaminate armor, and so its main attack method is ramming with its sturdy armored bow. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Kyoushuu Soukoukan Hammerhead
character.description: An armored assault ship used by Turbines, a subsidiary of Teiwaz. It is distinguished by the huge frontal armor installed on its bow. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Mcmurdo Barriston
character.description: The representative of Teiwaz, which has the greatest influence over the Jupiter routes. Teiwaz is a corporate giant whose main businesses are transportation and the development of Jupiter and the asteroid belt, and it has many affiliate companies under its umbrella. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Merribit Stapleton
character.description: A woman who works for the banking division of Teiwaz. On McMurdo`s orders, she takes charge of Tekkadan`s accounting. 2nd season:Dispatched from Teiwaz, she is responsible for accounting at Tekkadan`s Martian headquarters. She supports the boys of Tekkadan even though she is distressed by their way of life, which forces them to risk their lives. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Makanai Tougonosuke
character.description: The former Arbrau representative who has been negotiating with Kudelia to relax the regulations on Martian halfmetal resources. Suspected of corruption, he has now resigned as representative. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Aston Altland
character.description: A former "human debris" boy. He joined Tekkadan at Orga`s invitation, and now works for the Earth branch along with Takaki and the others. His mobile suit piloting skills put him in the top two among the Earth branch. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Derma Altland
character.description: Like Aston, this boy was treated as "human debris" by space pirates. Having joined Tekkadan, he now carries out combat missions in a mobile suit as part of the First Working Unit. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: ASW-G-08 Gundam Barbatos Lupus
character.description: Gundam Barbatos Lupus is the mobile suit that http://anidb.net/ch76361 [Mikazuki Augus] pilots. After many battles, and upgrades from Teiwaz, it has taken on a new form with enhanced weaponry. The mobile suit is one of the Gundam Frames used in the Calamity War 300 years ago. Source: ANN

character.name: Iok Kujan
character.description: Iok Kujan is the head of the Kujan family that belongs to the Seven Stars. He is responsible for part of the Arianrhod Fleet. Though he has command authority over his unit, he sometimes enters the battlefield himself as a pilot. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Cucubita Hugues
character.description: Cucubita Hugues is Admoss Company`s secretary and clerk. She deeply admires Kudelia, and covers for her unreliable company president. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Zack Lowe
character.description: Zack Lowe is a new member of http://anidb.net/ch76961 [Tekkadan]. He joined the group hoping to become a cool grown-up, and his instructor often admonishes him for his frivolity and lack of seriousness during drills. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Julieta Juris
character.description: Julieta Juris is a mobile suit pilot who belongs to the Arianrhod Fleet. Though she has no pedigree or rank, her piloting skills are outstanding, and Rustal took note of her abilities and assigned her to Arianrhod. She uses a customized version of the Reginlaze, the successor to the Graze. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Dane Uhai
character.description: Dane Uhai is a taciturn new member of http://anidb.net/ch76961 [Tekkadan]. He has a calm personality and quietly agrees with the comments of other members. Despite his size, he specializes in precision work, and so he is assigned to the maintenance crew. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Hush Middy
character.description: Hush Middy is a new member of http://anidb.net/ch76961 [Tekkadan]. Due to his personal history, he has a keen interest in the Alaya-Vijnana system and the ace pilot http://anidb.net/ch76361 [Mikazuki]. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Rustal Elion
character.description: Rustal Elion is the head of the Erion family that belongs to the Seven Stars. He serves as commander of the Outer Lunar Orbit Joint Fleet Arianrhod. With a heroic personality and the firm support of his subordinates, he has unquestioned influence within Gjallarhorn. He observes and counters McGillis`s secret maneuvering within the organization. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Radice Riloto
character.description: Diche Riroto is http://anidb.net/ch76961 [Tekkadan]`s Earth Branch auditor. He is normally in charge of accounts and administration. He is irritated by Tekkadan`s members, who are unable to think of things rationally and theoretically, and repeatedly quarrels with them. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Isurugi Camice
character.description: Isurugi Camice is a http://anidb.net/ch76951 [McGillis]` shy subordinate. Thanks to his unique network, he has access to information of Outer Sphere, and he also has high skill as a mobile suit pilot. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Garm Rodi
character.description: A mobile suit based on the Rodi Frame that was mass-produced in the middle stages of the Calamity War, and equipped with heavy armor. Taking advantage of the frame`s inherent versatility, this well-balanced mobile suit combines mobility with defensive performance. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: ASW-G-11 Gundam Gusion Rebake Full City
character.description: Gusion Rebake has been upgraded by Teiwaz into a new form after sustaining severe damage. It retains its previous gimmicks of high-sensitivity camera sensors in the head for long-range precision fire and a "face open" mode for close-range use, and new armament has also been added, including weapons more specialized for close combat. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: EB-06r Graze Ritter (McGillis Ki)
character.description: Though it often plays a symbolic role such as attending memorial ceremonies, this machine`s characteristics have been comprehensively reviewed now that McGillis has become commander of the Outer Earth Orbit Regulatory Joint Fleet. In particular, its ground combat data has been recalculated, enabling the machine to make maximum use of its mobility under Earth`s gravity. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: EB-04 Geirail
character.description: This mobile suit is essentially an older version of the Graze. After the introduction of the highly versatile Graze, only a few of these machines remained in service. It is now used based on the preference of regional Gjallarhorn organizations and retired mercenaries. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: IPP-66305 Hugo
character.description: A mobile suit with a unique form, whose Hexa Frame has been given backward-jointed legs. It was designed with the concept of improved capture and seizure in debris regions, and its combat specialty is seizing enemies with its basic armament of wire claws and leg claws, then finishing them off with mass weapons. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: EB-08s Reginlaze (Iok Ki)
character.description: This Reginlaze is a commander type, assigned to Arianrhod like Julieta`s machine, and used exclusively by Iok. At the suggestion of his mechanics and subordinates, its armament is mainly designed for long-range firing, and it is customized as a support type. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: EB-08s Reginlaze (Julieta Ki)
character.description: This is the successor to Gjallarhorn`s current main machine, the Graze. Several units from the initial rollout have been allocated to selected pilots chosen from within Arianrhod. The twin piles held in both its hands are an exclusive weapon which can be used for continuous attacks. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: STH-16 Shiden
character.description: A general-purpose mobile suit manufactured as a mass-production model based on Teiwaz`s Hyakuri and Hyakuren. It has a good balance of mobility, combat ability, and interchangeable equipment. Tekkadan, whose fighting strength is highly regarded within Teiwaz, has received a priority deployment at low cost. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Sandoval Reuters
character.description: The leader of the "Dawn Horizon Corps" space pirates. He takes pride in the reputation of his pirate corps, and resents the rapid growth that Tekkadan has achieved. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Jasley Donomikols
character.description: Effectively the number two of the corporate giant Teiwaz. He dislikes the rapidly expanding Tekkadan, and its patron Naze Turbine. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Allium Gyojan
character.description: A representative of the activist group Terra Liberionis. He is also the previously anonymous person who recommended Kudelia for the Noachis July Assembly. He aims to elevate his own position by currying favor with the now-famous Kudelia. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Vidal
character.description: A soldier assigned to the Arianrhod Fleet.

character.name: STH-16/tc Shiden Kai Shino Ki (Ryuusei Gou)
character.description: A Shiden that has been customized for Shino`s personal use. At his request, thrusters have been added to the shoulders and it is equipped with a short shield. It is designed so that Shino can make use of its high mobility in battle. The cockpit seat and other parts have also been transplanted from the old Ryuusei Gou, making this the only Shiden that can use the Alaya-Vijnana system. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: UGY-R41 Landman Rodi
character.description: After being captured, the Man Rodi used by the Brewers space pirates was modified into a ground type. It was then deployed to Tekkadan`s Earth branch. Because it is equipped with an Alaya-Vijnana system, it can display its full mobility even under Earth`s gravity. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Hotarubi
character.description: An armed transport belonging to Tekkadan. It was originally a cargo transporter, but since the organization now has so many mobile suits, a dedicated hangar was added, enabling it to carry a large number of mobile suits. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: ASW-G-64 Gundam Flauros
character.description: A Gundam Frame discovered at a halfmetal mine managed by Tekkadan. After its discovery, it was given an overhaul aboard the Saisei. Its colors and markings were applied at the insistence of the pilot. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Hashmal
character.description: A huge weapon excavated at Tekkadan`s halfmetal mine. This is one of the machines known as "mobile armors" that were dreaded as anti-personnel extermination weapons 300 years earlier. Source: en.gundam.info

episode.title: 出世の引き金
The Trigger of Success
Le déclic vers la réussite
Shusse no Hikigane
episode.summary: Mikazuki and Orga visit Allium, leader of the idealogical group Terra Liberionis, to resolve the issues surrounding the attacks of the Dawn Horizon Corps. Meanwhile, McGillis arrives at Gjallarhorn`s Martian branch, and he offers Tekkadan a certain proposal. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夜明け前の戦い
Battle Before Dawn
La bataille avant l`aube
Yoake Mae no Tatakai
episode.summary: Deploying all the fighting strength it possibly can, Tekkadan attempts to capture Sandoval Reuters, the leader of the Dawn Horizon Corps. During a hard fight against unequal odds, Gjallarhorn`s outer lunar orbit joint fleet Arianrhod also joins the battle. A three-way free-for-all begins between Tekkadan, the Arianrhod fleet, and the Dawn Horizon Corps. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 嫉心の渦中で
In the Midst of Jealousy
Au cœur de la jalousie
Shishin no Kachuu de
episode.summary: Despite some casualties, Tekkadan has successfully repulsed the space pirates of the Dawn Horizon Corps. It appears, however, that this enemy was just one part of a huge space pirate group, and Orga decides to counterattack in anticipation of further assaults. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新しい血
New Blood
Sang neuf
Atarashii Chi
episode.summary: Mikazuki`s group, Tekkadan, has been commissioned to escort Kudelia on an inspection of a halfmetal mine. Under Tekkadan`s protection, she completes the inspection schedule without incident. But suddenly, Tekkadan finds itself under attack by space pirates. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キスマイ宮田もどハマリ!? 機動戦士ガンダム 鉄血のオルフェンズ放送直前SP
Episode S1
Kiss My Miyata Mode Hamari!? Kidou Senshi Gundam: Tekketsu no Orphans Housou Chokuzen SP
火星の王
Sovereign of Mars
Rois de Mars
Kasei no Ou
episode.summary: The fighting ends as the rival economic blocs SAU and Arbrau agree to peace negotiations. As they remember their fallen comrades, the members of Tekkadan decide to withdraw from Earth. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 友よ
My Friend
Mon ami
Tomo yo
episode.summary: Gjallarhorn has received a mediation request from the SAU. In order to break the prolonged stalemate, McGillis personally enters the battlefield in a mobile suit. Galan`s team launches an attack on McGillis, who is whittling down Arbrau`s fighting strength. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 無音の戦争
Silent War
La guerre silencieuse
Muon no Sensou
episode.summary: A conflict between the rival economic blocs Arbrau and SAU breaks out as their armies clash on the Balfour Plain. Tekkadan also joins the battle under the command of Galan Mossa, but its members become exhausted as the war of attrition continues day after day. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アーブラウ防衛軍発足式典
Inauguration of the Arbrau Defense Forces
Instauration des forces de défense d`Arbrau
Arbrau Boueigun Hossoku Shikiten
episode.summary: Tekkadan`s Earth branch, which is now serving as a military advisor to Arbrau, is consumed with preparing the launch ceremony for the Arbrau Defense Forces. At Makanai`s request, Tekkadan takes charge of security for the ceremony venue. But with the sound of an explosion, black smoke rises from the site. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クリュセ防衛戦
Battle for Chryse
La bataille pour Chryse
Chryse Boueisen
episode.summary: Outnumbered, Tekkadan turns to McGillis for assistance, and launches a mobile armor mopping-up operation. Meanwhile, a strange phenomenon occurs in the Gundam Frames that are confronting the mobile armor. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 穢れた翼
Stained Wings
Les ailes souillées
Kegareta Tsubasa
episode.summary: The awakened mobile armor, along with a huge quantity of sub-units, heads for a densely populated area to begin its attack. Tekkadan attempts to hold back the onslaught, but is helpless against its overwhelming power and superior numbers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 目覚めし厄祭
Awakening Calamity
Le retour des calamités
Mezameshi Yakusai
episode.summary: Tekkadan has discovered a huge object at a mine it is managing. Having received a message from Orga about the object`s true nature, McGillis decides to pay a secret visit to Mars. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヴィダール立つ
Vidar Rising
Vidar entre en scène
Vidal Tatsu
episode.summary: Via a certain matter on Earth, the connection between Tekkadan and McGillis grows even stronger. Meanwhile, the Gundam Vidar, which has been undergoing adjustment by the Arianrhod fleet, finally rolls out. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天使を狩る者
Hunter of Angels
Chasseur d`ange
Tenshi o Karu Mono
episode.summary: Mikazuki faces off against the mobile armor. The battle continues with mounting intensity. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 落とし前
Settlement
Réglement de comptes
Otoshimae
episode.summary: With the repairs to the Barbatos complete, Tekkadan musters its fighting strength. The members ready their resolve for the confrontation with Jasley. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 人として当たり前の
Natural for a Human
Naturel pour un homme
Hito Toshite Atarimae no
episode.summary: A modest funeral service is held aboard the Saisei. But Jasley has been preparing yet another stratagem. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 燃ゆる太陽に照らされて
Lit by a Blazing Sun
Éclairé par un soleil brûlant
Moyuru Taiyou ni Terasarete
episode.summary: Tekkadan has been thwarted in its attempt to rescue Turbines from danger. Orga restrains himself in response to Naze`s wishes, but… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 助言
Counsel
Conseil
Jogen
episode.summary: Lafter and the other Turbines members take their leave of Tekkadan. Meanwhile, at Teiwaz, the organization`s number two Jasley Donomikols plans a new maneuver. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キスマイ宮田もどハマリ!「機動戦士ガンダム鉄血のオルフェンズ」今から観ても絶対間に合う! SP
Episode S2
Kiss My Miyata Mode Hamari! "Kidou Senshi Gundam: Tekketsu no Orphans" Ima kara Mite mo Zettai Ma ni Au! SP
たどりついた真意
Revealed Intentions
Intentions dévoilées
Tadoritsuita Shin`i
episode.summary: Gjallarhorn`s Earth headquarters has been captured in a coup d`etat by young officers. Among them is McGillis, who heads for a facility underneath the headquarters. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 生け贄
Scapegoat
Bouc émissaire
Ikenie
episode.summary: Tekkadan plans to return to its Martian headquarters and start over. The situation, however, has undergone a dramatic reversal. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 誰が為
For Whom?
Pour qui ?
Ta ga Tame
episode.summary: Tekkadan revives and launches an attack, aiming to escape the battlefield. Meanwhile, the fight between McGillis and Gaelio becomes increasingly ferocious. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: これが最後なら
If This Is the End
Si c`est la fin
Kore ga Saigo nara
episode.summary: After many complications, Tekkadan finally joins the battle against the Arianrhod fleet, but… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魂を手にした男
The Man Who Holds the Soul
L`homme qui détient l`âme
Tamashii o Te ni Shita Otoko
episode.summary: The Arianrhod fleet, led by Rustal Elion, attempts to gather all its forces to fight the coup d`état. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マクギリス・ファリド
McGillis Fareed
McGillis Fareed
McGillis Fareed
episode.summary: Gjallarhorn intends to launch a mopping-up operation against Tekkadan. The hour of its commencement is drawing steadily closer… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 約束
Promise
Promesse
Yakusoku
episode.summary: Tekkadan is in a difficult predicament. A huge Gjallarhorn force then begins deploying around its Martian headquarters. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 彼らの居場所
Their Place
Chez eux
Karera no Ibasho
episode.summary: Gjallarhorn begins its Tekkadan mopping-up operation. Facing this, Tekkadan`s future is… Source: crunchyroll
